title: Smothered Turkey Wings
description: Slow-roasted turkey wings are smothered in gravy made with a quick homemade stock. Smothered turkey wings are comfort food at its finest!

directions.name: Preheat the oven
sections: Preheat the oven to 275°F.

directions.name: Prep the turkey wings
sections: Using poultry sheers or a sharp knife, separate each turkey wing into 3 segments—drumette, flat, and tip
Set aside the tips (if you have them) for making stock.

directions.name: Slow roast the turkey wings
sections: Place turkey wing drumettes and flats, skin side up, onto a rimmed baking sheet or roasting pan
Toss with olive oil
Sprinkle with salt
Cover with aluminum foil and put into a 275°F oven for 2 1/2 hours.

directions.name: Make the stock
sections: While the turkey wing drumettes and flats are roasting, make stock with the tips
Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a medium, thick-bottomed pot on medium high heat
Add the turkey wing tips and let them brown on all sides
Add the chopped carrot, onion, and celery, and sauté them for a few minutes with the wings
Add 3 cups of water, enough to cover the wings and vegetables, and salt
Bring to a boil on high heat, then reduce to a low simmer on the lowest setting
Cover and let simmer while the wings roast in the oven, a couple of hours.

directions.name: Strain the stock
sections: When the wings are close to being done, strain the stock so you can start making the gravy
Remove and discard the largest solids from the pot
Then strain the rest of the stock through a fine mesh strainer
You should have about 3 cups of stock
Reserve for the next step.

directions.name: Make the gravy
sections: Make a roux by melting 3 tablespoons butter in a medium sized, thick-bottomed pot, on medium heat
Add the flour and whisk to combine
Let the roux cook and bubble for a minute or so
Slowly whisk in the turkey stock you made in steps, whisking constantly to break up any lumps
Whisk in the mustard, salt, pepper, and thyme
Whisk in the cream
Let simmer on low heat to thicken.

directions.name: Broil the wings to brown them
sections: After 2 1/2 hours of slow cooking in the oven, the turkey wings should be fall apart tender (if not, you can leave them in longer until they are)
Remove the foil and place the wings on a rack a few inches under the broiler
Broil for 5 minutes or so, until the skin gets somewhat browned.

directions.name: Scrape the pan drippings into the gravy
sections: You don't have to do this, but it will add even more flavor to your gravy
If the drippings are really stuck to the pan, place the roasting pan on your stovetop and turn on the burners under the pan
Add a cup of water to the pan and use a metal spatula to scrape up the drippings
Pour them off into the gray pot
To serve, pour the gravy over the wings
Serve with a side of mashed potatoes , root vegetables , or cauliflower .

directions.name: Serve the turkey wings with gravy
sections: To serve, pour the gravy over the wings
Serve with a side of mashed potatoes , root vegetables , or cauliflower .
